00031 #define DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM S_LQUOTA
00032 
00033 #include "qmt_internal.h"
00034 
00035 /*
00036  * Initialize qmt-specific fields of quota entry.
00037  *
00038  * \param lqe - is the quota entry to initialize
00039  * \param arg - is the pointer to the qmt_pool_info structure
00040  */
00041 static void qmt_lqe_init(struct lquota_entry *lqe, void *arg)
00042 {
00043         LASSERT(lqe_is_master(lqe));
00044 
00045         lqe->lqe_revoke_time = 0;
00046         init_rwsem(&lqe->lqe_sem);
00047 }
00048 
00049 /*
00050  * Update a lquota entry. This is done by reading quota settings from the global
00051  * index. The lquota entry must be write locked.
00052  *
00053  * \param env - the environment passed by the caller
00054  * \param lqe - is the quota entry to refresh
00055  * \param arg - is the pointer to the qmt_pool_info structure
00056  */
00057 static int qmt_lqe_read(const struct lu_env *env, struct lquota_entry *lqe,
00058                         void *arg)
00059 {
00060         struct qmt_thread_info  *qti = qmt_info(env);
00061         struct qmt_pool_info    *pool = (struct qmt_pool_info *)arg;
00062         int                      rc;
00063         ENTRY;
00064 
00065         LASSERT(lqe_is_master(lqe));
00066 
00067         /* read record from disk */
00068         rc = lquota_disk_read(env, pool->qpi_glb_obj[lqe->lqe_site->lqs_qtype],
00069                               &lqe->lqe_id, (struct dt_rec *)&qti->qti_glb_rec);
00070 
00071         switch (rc) {
00072         case -ENOENT:
00073                 /* no such entry, assume quota isn't enforced for this user */
00074                 lqe->lqe_enforced = false;
00075                 break;
00076         case 0:
00077                 /* copy quota settings from on-disk record */
00078                 lqe->lqe_granted   = qti->qti_glb_rec.qbr_granted;
00079                 lqe->lqe_hardlimit = qti->qti_glb_rec.qbr_hardlimit;
00080                 lqe->lqe_softlimit = qti->qti_glb_rec.qbr_softlimit;
00081                 lqe->lqe_gracetime = qti->qti_glb_rec.qbr_time;
00082 
00083                 if (lqe->lqe_hardlimit == 0 && lqe->lqe_softlimit == 0)
00084                         /* {hard,soft}limit=0 means no quota enforced */
00085                         lqe->lqe_enforced = false;
00086                 else
00087                         lqe->lqe_enforced  = true;
00088 
00089                 break;
00090         default:
00091                 LQUOTA_ERROR(lqe, "failed to read quota entry from disk, rc:%d",
00092                              rc);
00093                 RETURN(rc);
00094         }
00095 
00096         LQUOTA_DEBUG(lqe, "read");
00097         RETURN(0);
00098 }
00099 
00100 /*
00101  * Print lqe information for debugging.
00102  *
00103  * \param lqe - is the quota entry to debug
00104  * \param arg - is the pointer to the qmt_pool_info structure
00105  * \param msgdata - debug message
00106  * \param fmt     - format of debug message
00107  */
00108 static void qmt_lqe_debug(struct lquota_entry *lqe, void *arg,
00109                           struct libcfs_debug_msg_data *msgdata,
00110                           const char *fmt, va_list args)
00111 {
00112         struct qmt_pool_info    *pool = (struct qmt_pool_info *)arg;
00113 
00114         libcfs_debug_vmsg2(msgdata, fmt, args,
00115                            "qmt:%s pool:%d-%s id:"LPU64" enforced:%d hard:"LPU64
00116                            " soft:"LPU64" granted:"LPU64" time:"LPU64" qunit:"
00117                            LPU64" edquot:%d may_rel:"LPU64" revoke:"LPU64"\n",
00118                            pool->qpi_qmt->qmt_svname,
00119                            pool->qpi_key & 0x0000ffff,
00120                            RES_NAME(pool->qpi_key >> 16),
00121                            lqe->lqe_id.qid_uid, lqe->lqe_enforced,
00122                            lqe->lqe_hardlimit, lqe->lqe_softlimit,
00123                            lqe->lqe_granted, lqe->lqe_gracetime,
00124                            lqe->lqe_qunit, lqe->lqe_edquot, lqe->lqe_may_rel,
00125                            lqe->lqe_revoke_time);
00126 }
00127 
00128 /*
00129  * Vector of quota entry operations supported on the master
00130  */
00131 struct lquota_entry_operations qmt_lqe_ops = {
00132         .lqe_init       = qmt_lqe_init,
00133         .lqe_read       = qmt_lqe_read,
00134         .lqe_debug      = qmt_lqe_debug,
00135 };
00136 
00137 /*
00138  * Reserve enough credits to update records in both the global index and
00139  * the slave index identified by \slv_obj
00140  *
00141  * \param env     - is the environment passed by the caller
00142  * \param lqe     - is the quota entry associated with the identifier
00143  *                  subject to the change
00144  * \param slv_obj - is the dt_object associated with the index file
00145  * \param restore - is a temporary storage for current quota settings which will
00146  *                  be restored if something goes wrong at index update time.
00147  */
00148 struct thandle *qmt_trans_start_with_slv(const struct lu_env *env,
00149                                          struct lquota_entry *lqe,
00150                                          struct dt_object *slv_obj,
00151                                          struct qmt_lqe_restore *restore)
00152 {
00153         struct qmt_device       *qmt;
00154         struct thandle          *th;
00155         int                      rc;
00156         ENTRY;
00157 
00158         LASSERT(lqe != NULL);
00159         LASSERT(lqe_is_master(lqe));
00160 
00161         qmt = lqe2qpi(lqe)->qpi_qmt;
00162 
00163         if (slv_obj != NULL)
00164                 LQUOTA_DEBUG(lqe, "declare write for slv "DFID,
00165                              PFID(lu_object_fid(&slv_obj->do_lu)));
00166 
00167         /* start transaction */
00168         th = dt_trans_create(env, qmt->qmt_child);
00169         if (IS_ERR(th))
00170                 RETURN(th);
00171 
00172         if (slv_obj == NULL)
00173                 /* quota settings on master are updated synchronously for the
00174                  * time being */
00175                 th->th_sync = 1;
00176 
00177         /* reserve credits for global index update */
00178         rc = lquota_disk_declare_write(env, th, LQE_GLB_OBJ(lqe), &lqe->lqe_id);
00179         if (rc)
00180                 GOTO(out, rc);
00181 
00182         if (slv_obj != NULL) {
00183                 /* reserve credits for slave index update */
00184                 rc = lquota_disk_declare_write(env, th, slv_obj, &lqe->lqe_id);
00185                 if (rc)
00186                         GOTO(out, rc);
00187         }
00188 
00189         /* start transaction */
00190         rc = dt_trans_start_local(env, qmt->qmt_child, th);
00191         if (rc)
00192                 GOTO(out, rc);
00193 
00194         EXIT;
00195 out:
00196         if (rc) {
00197                 dt_trans_stop(env, qmt->qmt_child, th);
00198                 th = ERR_PTR(rc);
00199                 LQUOTA_ERROR(lqe, "failed to slv declare write for "DFID
00200                              ", rc:%d", PFID(lu_object_fid(&slv_obj->do_lu)),
00201                              rc);
00202         } else {
00203                 restore->qlr_hardlimit = lqe->lqe_hardlimit;
00204                 restore->qlr_softlimit = lqe->lqe_softlimit;
00205                 restore->qlr_gracetime = lqe->lqe_gracetime;
00206                 restore->qlr_granted   = lqe->lqe_granted;
00207                 restore->qlr_qunit     = lqe->lqe_qunit;
00208         }
00209         return th;
00210 }
00211 
00212 /*
00213  * Reserve enough credits to update a record in the global index
00214  *
00215  * \param env     - is the environment passed by the caller
00216  * \param lqe     - is the quota entry to be modified in the global index
00217  * \param restore - is a temporary storage for current quota settings which will
00218  *                  be restored if something goes wrong at index update time.
00219  */
00220 struct thandle *qmt_trans_start(const struct lu_env *env,
00221                                 struct lquota_entry *lqe,
00222                                 struct qmt_lqe_restore *restore)
00223 {
00224         LQUOTA_DEBUG(lqe, "declare write");
00225         return qmt_trans_start_with_slv(env, lqe, NULL, restore);
00226 }
00227 
00228 /*
00229  * Update record associated with a quota entry in the global index.
00230  * If LQUOTA_BUMP_VER is set, then the global index version must also be
00231  * bumped.
00232  * The entry must be at least read locked, dirty and up-to-date.
00233  *
00234  * \param env   - the environment passed by the caller
00235  * \param th    - is the transaction handle to be used for the disk writes
00236  * \param lqe   - is the quota entry to udpate
00237  * \param obj   - is the dt_object associated with the index file
00238  * \param flags - can be LQUOTA_BUMP_VER or LQUOTA_SET_VER.
00239  * \param ver   - is used to return the new version of the index.
00240  *
00241  * \retval      - 0 on success and lqe dirty flag cleared,
00242  *                appropriate error on failure and uptodate flag cleared.
00243  */
00244 int qmt_glb_write(const struct lu_env *env, struct thandle *th,
00245                   struct lquota_entry *lqe, __u32 flags, __u64 *ver)
00246 {
00247         struct qmt_thread_info  *qti = qmt_info(env);
00248         struct lquota_glb_rec   *rec;
00249         int                      rc;
00250         ENTRY;
00251 
00252         LASSERT(lqe != NULL);
00253         LASSERT(lqe_is_master(lqe));
00254         LASSERT(lqe_is_locked(lqe));
00255         LASSERT(lqe->lqe_uptodate);
00256         LASSERT((flags & ~(LQUOTA_BUMP_VER | LQUOTA_SET_VER)) == 0);
00257 
00258         LQUOTA_DEBUG(lqe, "write glb");
00259 
00260         /* never delete the entry even when the id isn't enforced and
00261          * no any guota granted, otherwise, this entry will not be
00262          * synced to slave during the reintegration. */
00263         rec = &qti->qti_glb_rec;
00264 
00265         /* fill global index with updated quota settings */
00266         rec->qbr_granted   = lqe->lqe_granted;
00267         rec->qbr_hardlimit = lqe->lqe_hardlimit;
00268         rec->qbr_softlimit = lqe->lqe_softlimit;
00269         rec->qbr_time      = lqe->lqe_gracetime;
00270 
00271         /* write new quota settings */
00272         rc = lquota_disk_write(env, th, LQE_GLB_OBJ(lqe), &lqe->lqe_id,
00273                                (struct dt_rec *)rec, flags, ver);
00274         if (rc)
00275                 /* we failed to write the new quota settings to disk, report
00276                  * error to caller who will restore the initial value */
00277                 LQUOTA_ERROR(lqe, "failed to update global index, rc:%d", rc);
00278 
00279         RETURN(rc);
00280 }
00281 
00282 /*
00283  * Read from disk how much quota space is allocated to a slave.
00284  * This is done by reading records from the dedicated slave index file.
00285  * Return in \granted how much quota space is currently allocated to the
00286  * slave.
00287  * The entry must be at least read locked.
00288  *
00289  * \param env - the environment passed by the caller
00290  * \param lqe - is the quota entry associated with the identifier to look-up
00291  *              in the slave index
00292  * \param slv_obj - is the dt_object associated with the slave index
00293  * \param granted - is the output parameter where to return how much space
00294  *                  is granted to the slave.
00295  *
00296  * \retval    - 0 on success, appropriate error on failure
00297  */
00298 int qmt_slv_read(const struct lu_env *env, struct lquota_entry *lqe,
00299                  struct dt_object *slv_obj, __u64 *granted)
00300 {
00301         struct qmt_thread_info  *qti = qmt_info(env);
00302         struct lquota_slv_rec   *slv_rec = &qti->qti_slv_rec;
00303         int                      rc;
00304         ENTRY;
00305 
00306         LASSERT(lqe != NULL);
00307         LASSERT(lqe_is_master(lqe));
00308         LASSERT(lqe_is_locked(lqe));
00309 
00310         LQUOTA_DEBUG(lqe, "read slv "DFID,
00311                      PFID(lu_object_fid(&slv_obj->do_lu)));
00312 
00313         /* read slave record from disk */
00314         rc = lquota_disk_read(env, slv_obj, &lqe->lqe_id,
00315                               (struct dt_rec *)slv_rec);
00316         switch (rc) {
00317         case -ENOENT:
00318                 *granted = 0;
00319                 break;
00320         case 0:
00321                 /* extract granted from on-disk record */
00322                 *granted = slv_rec->qsr_granted;
00323                 break;
00324         default:
00325                 LQUOTA_ERROR(lqe, "failed to read slave record "DFID,
00326                              PFID(lu_object_fid(&slv_obj->do_lu)));
00327                 RETURN(rc);
00328         }
00329 
00330         LQUOTA_DEBUG(lqe, "successful slv read "LPU64, *granted);
00331 
00332         RETURN(0);
00333 }
00334 
00335 /*
00336  * Update record in slave index file.
00337  * The entry must be at least read locked.
00338  *
00339  * \param env - the environment passed by the caller
00340  * \param th  - is the transaction handle to be used for the disk writes
00341  * \param lqe - is the dirty quota entry which will be updated at the same time
00342  *              as the slave index
00343  * \param slv_obj - is the dt_object associated with the slave index
00344  * \param flags - can be LQUOTA_BUMP_VER or LQUOTA_SET_VER.
00345  * \param ver   - is used to return the new version of the index.
00346  * \param granted - is the new amount of quota space owned by the slave
00347  *
00348  * \retval    - 0 on success, appropriate error on failure
00349  */
00350 int qmt_slv_write(const struct lu_env *env, struct thandle *th,
00351                   struct lquota_entry *lqe, struct dt_object *slv_obj,
00352                   __u32 flags, __u64 *ver, __u64 granted)
00353 {
00354         struct qmt_thread_info  *qti = qmt_info(env);
00355         struct lquota_slv_rec   *rec;
00356         int                      rc;
00357         ENTRY;
00358 
00359         LASSERT(lqe != NULL);
00360         LASSERT(lqe_is_master(lqe));
00361         LASSERT(lqe_is_locked(lqe));
00362 
00363         LQUOTA_DEBUG(lqe, "write slv "DFID" granted:"LPU64,
00364                      PFID(lu_object_fid(&slv_obj->do_lu)), granted);
00365 
00366         /* never delete the entry, otherwise, it'll not be transferred
00367          * to slave during reintegration. */
00368         rec = &qti->qti_slv_rec;
00369 
00370         /* updated space granted to this slave */
00371         rec->qsr_granted = granted;
00372 
00373         /* write new granted space */
00374         rc = lquota_disk_write(env, th, slv_obj, &lqe->lqe_id,
00375                                (struct dt_rec *)rec, flags, ver);
00376         if (rc) {
00377                 LQUOTA_ERROR(lqe, "failed to update slave index "DFID" granted:"
00378                              LPU64, PFID(lu_object_fid(&slv_obj->do_lu)),
00379                              granted);
00380                 RETURN(rc);
00381         }
00382 
00383         RETURN(0);
00384 }
00385 
00386 /*
00387  * Check whether new limits are valid for this pool
00388  *
00389  * \param lqe  - is the quota entry subject to the setquota
00390  * \param hard - is the new hard limit
00391  * \param soft - is the new soft limit
00392  */
00393 int qmt_validate_limits(struct lquota_entry *lqe, __u64 hard, __u64 soft)
00394 {
00395         ENTRY;
00396 
00397         if (hard != 0 && soft > hard)
00398                 /* soft limit must be less than hard limit */
00399                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00400         RETURN(0);
00401 }
00402 
00403 /*
00404  * Set/clear edquot flag after quota space allocation/release or settings
00405  * change. Slaves will be notified of changes via glimpse on per-ID lock
00406  *
00407  * \param lqe - is the quota entry to check
00408  * \param now - is the current time in second used for grace time managment
00409  */
00410 void qmt_adjust_edquot(struct lquota_entry *lqe, __u64 now)
00411 {
00412         struct qmt_pool_info    *pool = lqe2qpi(lqe);
00413         ENTRY;
00414 
00415         if (!lqe->lqe_enforced || lqe->lqe_id.qid_uid == 0)
00416                 RETURN_EXIT;
00417 
00418         if (!lqe->lqe_edquot) {
00419                 /* space exhausted flag not set, let's check whether it is time
00420                  * to set the flag */
00421 
00422                 if (!qmt_space_exhausted(lqe, now))
00423                         /* the qmt still has available space */
00424                         RETURN_EXIT;
00425 
00426                 /* See comment in qmt_adjust_qunit(). LU-4139 */
00427                 if (qmt_hard_exhausted(lqe) ||
00428                     pool->qpi_key >> 16 != LQUOTA_RES_DT) {
00429                         /* we haven't reached the minimal qunit yet so there is
00430                          * still hope that the rebalancing process might free
00431                          * up some quota space */
00432                         if (lqe->lqe_qunit != pool->qpi_least_qunit)
00433                                 RETURN_EXIT;
00434 
00435                         /* least qunit value not sent to all slaves yet */
00436                         if (lqe->lqe_revoke_time == 0)
00437                                 RETURN_EXIT;
00438 
00439                         /* Let's give more time to slave to release space */
00440                         if (lqe->lqe_may_rel != 0 &&
00441                             cfs_time_before_64(cfs_time_shift_64(
00442                                                         -QMT_REBA_TIMEOUT),
00443                                                lqe->lqe_revoke_time))
00444                                 RETURN_EXIT;
00445                 } else {
00446                         if (lqe->lqe_qunit > pool->qpi_soft_least_qunit)
00447                                 RETURN_EXIT;
00448                 }
00449 
00450                 /* set edquot flag */
00451                 lqe->lqe_edquot = true;
00452         } else {
00453                 /* space exhausted flag set, let's check whether it is time to
00454                  * clear it */
00455 
00456                 if (qmt_space_exhausted(lqe, now))
00457                         /* the qmt still has not space */
00458                         RETURN_EXIT;
00459 
00460                 if (lqe->lqe_hardlimit != 0 &&
00461                     lqe->lqe_granted + pool->qpi_least_qunit >
00462                                                         lqe->lqe_hardlimit)
00463                         /* we clear the flag only once at least one least qunit
00464                          * is available */
00465                         RETURN_EXIT;
00466 
00467                 /* clear edquot flag */
00468                 lqe->lqe_edquot = false;
00469         }
00470 
00471         LQUOTA_DEBUG(lqe, "changing edquot flag");
00472 
00473         /* let's notify slave by issuing glimpse on per-ID lock.
00474          * the rebalance thread will take care of this */
00475         qmt_id_lock_notify(pool->qpi_qmt, lqe);
00476         EXIT;
00477 }
00478 
00479 /* Using least_qunit when over block softlimit will seriously impact the
00480  * write performance, we need to do some special tweaking on that. */
00481 static __u64 qmt_calc_softlimit(struct lquota_entry *lqe, bool *oversoft)
00482 {
00483         struct qmt_pool_info *pool = lqe2qpi(lqe);
00484 
00485         LASSERT(lqe->lqe_softlimit != 0);
00486         *oversoft = false;
00487         /* No need to do special tweaking for inode limit */
00488         if (pool->qpi_key >> 16 != LQUOTA_RES_DT)
00489                 return lqe->lqe_softlimit;
00490 
00491         if (lqe->lqe_granted <= lqe->lqe_softlimit +
00492                                 pool->qpi_soft_least_qunit) {
00493                 return lqe->lqe_softlimit;
00494         } else if (lqe->lqe_hardlimit != 0) {
00495                 *oversoft = true;
00496                 return lqe->lqe_hardlimit;
00497         } else {
00498                 *oversoft = true;
00499                 return 0;
00500         }
00501 }
00502 
00503 /*
00504  * Try to grant more quota space back to slave.
00505  *
00506  * \param lqe     - is the quota entry for which we would like to allocate more
00507  *                  space
00508  * \param granted - is how much was already granted as part of the request
00509  *                  processing
00510  * \param spare   - is how much unused quota space the slave already owns
00511  *
00512  * \retval return how additional space can be granted to the slave
00513  */
00514 __u64 qmt_alloc_expand(struct lquota_entry *lqe, __u64 granted, __u64 spare)
00515 {
00516         struct qmt_pool_info    *pool = lqe2qpi(lqe);
00517         __u64                    remaining, qunit;
00518         int                      slv_cnt;
00519 
00520         LASSERT(lqe->lqe_enforced && lqe->lqe_qunit != 0);
00521 
00522         slv_cnt = lqe2qpi(lqe)->qpi_slv_nr[lqe->lqe_site->lqs_qtype];
00523         qunit   = lqe->lqe_qunit;
00524 
00525         /* See comment in qmt_adjust_qunit(). LU-4139. */
00526         if (lqe->lqe_softlimit != 0) {
00527                 bool oversoft;
00528                 remaining = qmt_calc_softlimit(lqe, &oversoft);
00529                 if (remaining == 0)
00530                         remaining = lqe->lqe_granted +
00531                                     pool->qpi_soft_least_qunit;
00532         } else {
00533                 remaining = lqe->lqe_hardlimit;
00534         }
00535 
00536         if (lqe->lqe_granted >= remaining)
00537                 RETURN(0);
00538 
00539         remaining -= lqe->lqe_granted;
00540 
00541         do {
00542                 if (spare >= qunit)
00543                         break;
00544 
00545                 granted &= (qunit - 1);
00546 
00547                 if (remaining > (slv_cnt * qunit) >> 1) {
00548                         /* enough room to grant more space w/o additional
00549                          * shrinking ... at least for now */
00550                         remaining -= (slv_cnt * qunit) >> 1;
00551                 } else if (qunit != pool->qpi_least_qunit) {
00552                         qunit >>= 2;
00553                         continue;
00554                 }
00555 
00556                 granted &= (qunit - 1);
00557                 if (spare > 0)
00558                         RETURN(min_t(__u64, qunit - spare, remaining));
00559                 else
00560                         RETURN(min_t(__u64, qunit - granted, remaining));
00561         } while (qunit >= pool->qpi_least_qunit);
00562 
00563         RETURN(0);
00564 }
00565 
00566 /*
00567  * Adjust qunit size according to quota limits and total granted count.
00568  * The caller must have locked the lqe.
00569  *
00570  * \param env - the environment passed by the caller
00571  * \param lqe - is the qid entry to be adjusted
00572  */
00573 void qmt_adjust_qunit(const struct lu_env *env, struct lquota_entry *lqe)
00574 {
00575         struct qmt_pool_info    *pool = lqe2qpi(lqe);
00576         int                      slv_cnt;
00577         __u64                    qunit, limit, qunit2 = 0;
00578         ENTRY;
00579 
00580         LASSERT(lqe_is_locked(lqe));
00581 
00582         if (!lqe->lqe_enforced || lqe->lqe_id.qid_uid == 0)
00583                 /* no quota limits */
00584                 RETURN_EXIT;
00585 
00586         /* record how many slaves have already registered */
00587         slv_cnt = pool->qpi_slv_nr[lqe->lqe_site->lqs_qtype];
00588         if (slv_cnt == 0)
00589                 /* wait for at least one slave to join */
00590                 RETURN_EXIT;
00591 
00592         /* Qunit calculation is based on soft limit, if any, hard limit
00593          * otherwise. This means that qunit is shrunk to the minimum when
00594          * beyond the soft limit. This will impact performance, but that's the
00595          * price of an accurate grace time management. */
00596         if (lqe->lqe_softlimit != 0) {
00597                 bool oversoft;
00598                 /* As a compromise of write performance and the grace time
00599                  * accuracy, the block qunit size will be shrunk to
00600                  * qpi_soft_least_qunit when over softlimit. LU-4139. */
00601                 limit = qmt_calc_softlimit(lqe, &oversoft);
00602                 if (oversoft)
00603                         qunit2 = pool->qpi_soft_least_qunit;
00604                 if (limit == 0)
00605                         GOTO(done, qunit = qunit2);
00606         } else if (lqe->lqe_hardlimit != 0) {
00607                 limit = lqe->lqe_hardlimit;
00608         } else {
00609                 LQUOTA_ERROR(lqe, "enforced bit set, but neither hard nor soft "
00610                              "limit are set");
00611                 RETURN_EXIT;
00612         }
00613 
00614         qunit = lqe->lqe_qunit == 0 ? pool->qpi_least_qunit : lqe->lqe_qunit;
00615 
00616         /* The qunit value is computed as follows: limit / (2 * slv_cnt).
00617          * Then 75% of the quota space can be granted with current qunit value.
00618          * The remaining 25% are then used with reduced qunit size (by a factor
00619          * of 4) which is then divided in a similar manner.
00620          *
00621          * |---------------------limit---------------------|
00622          * |-------limit / 2-------|-limit / 4-|-limit / 4-|
00623          * |qunit|qunit|qunit|qunit|           |           |
00624          * |----slv_cnt * qunit----|           |           |
00625          * |-grow limit-|          |           |           |
00626          * |--------------shrink limit---------|           |
00627          * |---space granted in qunit chunks---|-remaining-|
00628          *                                    /             \
00629          *                                   /               \
00630          *                                  /                 \
00631          *                                 /                   \
00632          *                                /                     \
00633          *     qunit >>= 2;            |qunit*slv_cnt|qunit*slv_cnt|
00634          *                             |---space in qunit---|remain|
00635          *                                  ...                               */
00636         if (qunit == pool->qpi_least_qunit ||
00637             limit >= lqe->lqe_granted + ((slv_cnt * qunit) >> 1)) {
00638                 /* current qunit value still fits, let's see if we can afford to
00639                  * increase qunit now ...
00640                  * To increase qunit again, we have to be under 25% */
00641                 while (qunit && limit >= lqe->lqe_granted + 6 * qunit * slv_cnt)
00642                         qunit <<= 2;
00643 
00644                 if (!qunit) {
00645                         qunit = limit;
00646                         do_div(qunit, 2 * slv_cnt);
00647                 }
00648 
00649         } else {
00650                 /* shrink qunit until we find a suitable value */
00651                 while (qunit > pool->qpi_least_qunit &&
00652                        limit < lqe->lqe_granted + ((slv_cnt * qunit) >> 1))
00653                         qunit >>= 2;
00654         }
00655 
00656         if (qunit2 && qunit > qunit2)
00657                 qunit = qunit2;
00658 done:
00659         if (lqe->lqe_qunit == qunit)
00660                 /* keep current qunit */
00661                 RETURN_EXIT;
00662 
00663         LQUOTA_DEBUG(lqe, "%s qunit to "LPU64,
00664                      lqe->lqe_qunit < qunit ? "increasing" : "decreasing",
00665                      qunit);
00666 
00667         /* store new qunit value */
00668         swap(lqe->lqe_qunit, qunit);
00669 
00670         /* reset revoke time */
00671         lqe->lqe_revoke_time = 0;
00672 
00673         if (lqe->lqe_qunit < qunit)
00674                 /* let's notify slave of qunit shrinking */
00675                 qmt_id_lock_notify(pool->qpi_qmt, lqe);
00676         else if (lqe->lqe_qunit == pool->qpi_least_qunit)
00677                 /* initial qunit value is the smallest one */
00678                 lqe->lqe_revoke_time = cfs_time_current_64();
00679         EXIT;
00680 }
00681 
00682 /*
00683  * Adjust qunit & edquot flag in case it wasn't initialized already (e.g.
00684  * limit set while no slaves were connected yet)
00685  */
00686 void qmt_revalidate(const struct lu_env *env, struct lquota_entry *lqe)
00687 {
00688         if (lqe->lqe_qunit == 0) {
00689                 /* lqe was read from disk, but neither qunit, nor edquot flag
00690                  * were initialized */
00691                 qmt_adjust_qunit(env, lqe);
00692                 if (lqe->lqe_qunit != 0)
00693                         qmt_adjust_edquot(lqe, cfs_time_current_sec());
00694         }
00695 }
